TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataGridViewHeaderCell extends System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell

Docs.summary: Contains functionality common to row header cells and column header cells.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class is a base class for other header cell classes, such as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell>. To create custom row header icons or column header glyphs, inherit from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell> class and add functionality to paint your own icon or glyph.

block.para: When you derive from and add new properties to the derived class, be sure to override the method to copy the new properties during cloning operations. You should also call the base class's method so that the properties of the base class are copied to the new cell.

MemberSignature.Value: Protected ReadOnly Property ButtonState As ButtonState
protected: property System::Windows::Forms::ButtonState ButtonState { System::Windows::Forms::ButtonState get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the buttonlike visual state of the header cell.
Docs.value: One of the values; the default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell> is like a button in that it can be clicked to set states, such as sorting or performing row-level selection. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.ButtonState%2A> property uses <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ButtonState?displayProperty=nameWithType> values to provide buttonlike visual states.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance object Clone() cil managed
Public Overrides Function Clone () As Object

Docs.summary: Creates an exact copy of this cell.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Override the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.Clone%2A> method whenever you derive from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell> and add new properties to the derived class.

block.para: When overriding in a derived class, call the base class's method so that the properties of the base class are copied to the new cell, and be sure to also copy the values of any properties that were added to the derived class.

Docs.summary: Gets the type of the formatted value of the cell.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.Value%2A> property is the actual data object contained by the cell, whereas the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.FormattedValue%2A> property is the formatted representation of the data. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.ValueType%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.FormattedValueType%2A> properties correspond to the data types of these values, respectively.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property Frozen As Boolean
public: virtual property bool Frozen { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the cell is frozen.
Docs.value: if the cell is frozen; otherwise, . The default is if the cell is detached from a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.Frozen%2A> property is `true` if the cell belongs to a frozen row or column, or if the cell is the top-left header cell. A cell, row, or column is frozen when its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElement.State%2A> property has a value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates.Frozen?displayProperty=nameWithType>

Docs.summary: Gets the shortcut menu of the header cell.
Docs.returns: A if the or has a shortcut menu assigned; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell> does not have a shortcut menu, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell> will inherit the shortcut menu from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>. If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> also does not have a shortcut menu, then the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.GetInheritedContextMenuStrip%2A> method will return `null`.

The cell is a row header cell, the cell is not contained within a control, and is not -1.
\- or -

\- or -

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance valuetype System.Drawing.Size GetSize(int32 rowIndex) cil managed
Protected Overrides Function GetSize (rowIndex As Integer) As Size

Docs.param: The row index of the header cell.
Docs.summary: Gets the size of the cell.
Docs.returns: A that represents the size of the header cell.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.GetSize%2A> method returns the size necessary to fit in a row of column headers if the header cell is a column header, the size necessary to fit in a column of row headers if the header cell is a row header, or the size necessary to be a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTopLeftHeaderCell> if the cell is a top left header cell.
If the cell is not attached to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.Size%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell> returns the value (-1,-1).

Docs.exception:
The value of the property for this cell is and does not equal -1.
-or-
The value of the property for this cell is not and does not equal -1.
-or-
The value of the property for this cell is not and is less than zero or greater than or equal to the number of rows in the control.
-or-
The values of the and properties of this cell are both and does not equal -1.
The value of the property for this cell is not and indicates a row other than the .

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool MouseDownUnsharesRow(class System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs e) cil managed
Protected Overrides Function MouseDownUnsharesRow (e As DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs) As Boolean

Docs.param: A that contains information about the mouse position.
Docs.summary: Indicates whether a row will be unshared when the mouse button is held down while the pointer is on a cell in the row.
Docs.returns: if the user clicks with the left mouse button, visual styles are enabled, and the property is ; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks For information about enabling visual styles, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.EnableVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.MouseDownUnsharesRow%2A> is called just before <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.OnMouseDown%2A>. It must return `true` if the call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.OnMouseDown%2A> has the effect of unsharing the row `rowIndex`. It should return `false` otherwise.
For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).

Docs.related: Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control

Docs.param: The index of the row that the mouse pointer entered.
Docs.summary: Indicates whether a row will be unshared when the mouse pointer moves over a cell in the row.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For information about enabling visual styles, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.EnableVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.MouseEnterUnsharesRow%2A> is called just before <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.OnMouseEnter%2A>. It must return `true` if the call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.OnMouseEnter%2A> has the effect of unsharing the row `rowIndex`. It should return `false` otherwise.
For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).

block.para: When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class' method so that registered delegates receive the event.

Docs.related: Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnMouseDown(class System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs e) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub OnMouseDown (e As DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs)

Docs.param: A that contains information about the mouse position.
Docs.summary: Called when the mouse button is held down while the pointer is on a cell.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.OnMouseDown%2A> method sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.ButtonState%2A> to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ButtonState.Pushed> if the cell is clicked with the left mouse button and visual styles are enabled for headers. For more information about visual styles for headers, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EnableHeadersVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property.
This method is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.OnCellMouseDown%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method. It is called in the same circumstances in which a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellMouseDown?displayProperty=nameWithType> event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.

block.para: When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnMouseEnter(int32 rowIndex) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub OnMouseEnter (rowIndex As Integer)

Docs.param: The index of the row containing the cell.
Docs.summary: Called when the mouse pointer enters the cell.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.OnMouseEnter%2A> method sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.ButtonState%2A> to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ButtonState.Pushed> if the left mouse button is pressed when the pointer enters the cell and visual styles are enabled for headers. For more information about visual styles for headers, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EnableHeadersVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property.
This method is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.OnCellMouseEnter%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method. It is called in the same circumstances in which a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellMouseEnter?displayProperty=nameWithType> event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.

block.para: When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnMouseLeave(int32 rowIndex) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub OnMouseLeave (rowIndex As Integer)

Docs.param: The index of the row containing the cell.
Docs.summary: Called when the mouse pointer leaves the cell.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.OnMouseLeave%2A> method sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.ButtonState%2A> to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ButtonState.Normal> if it was in another state and visual styles are enabled for headers. For more information about visual styles for headers, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EnableHeadersVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property.
This method is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.OnCellMouseLeave%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method. It is called in the same circumstances in which a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellMouseLeave?displayProperty=nameWithType> event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.

block.para: When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnMouseUp(class System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs e) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub OnMouseUp (e As DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs)

Docs.param: A that contains information about the mouse position.
Docs.summary: Called when the mouse button is released while the pointer is over the cell.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.OnMouseUp%2A> method sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell.ButtonState%2A> to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ButtonState.Normal> if the left mouse button was released and visual styles are enabled for headers. For more information about visual styles for headers, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EnableHeadersVisualStyles%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property.
This method is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.OnCellMouseUp%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method. It is called in the same circumstances in which a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellMouseUp?displayProperty=nameWithType> event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.

block.para: When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's method.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property Resizable As Boolean
public: virtual property bool Resizable { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the cell is resizable.
Docs.value: if this cell can be resized; otherwise, . The default is if the cell is not attached to a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks A row header cell is resizable if the row is resizable or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowHeadersWidthSizeMode%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeadersWidthSizeMode.EnableResizing>. A column header cell is resizable if the column is resizable or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.ColumnHeadersHeightSizeMode%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeadersHeightSizeMode.EnableResizing>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is not meaningful for header cells.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overrides ReadOnly Property Visible As Boolean
public: virtual property bool Visible { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not the cell is visible.
Docs.value: if the cell is visible; otherwise, . The default is if the cell is detached from a

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the cell is a row header cell, then it is visible if its row is visible and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowHeadersVisible%2A> property is `true`. If the cell is a column header cell, then it is visible if its column is visible and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.ColumnHeadersVisible%2A> property is `true`. If the cell is the top left header cell, it is visible if both <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.RowHeadersVisible%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.ColumnHeadersVisible%2A> are true.
